title: Astronauts prep for new solar arrays on nearly seven-hour spacewalk
summary: Astronauts Kayla Barron and Raja Chari floated out of the International Space Station airlock for a spacewalk Tuesday, installing brackets and struts to support new solar arrays to upgrade the research lab’s power system on the same day that crewmate Mark Vande Hei marked his 341st day in orbit, a U.S. record for a single spaceflight.

title: NASA Extends Ingenuity Helicopter Mission
summary: With its recent 21st flight complete, the Red Planet rotorcraft is on its way to setting more records during its second year of operations.

title: DoD estimates $2.5 billion price tag for global constellation to track hypersonic missiles
summary: A $550 million congressional add-on in 2022 would only be a down payment to kickstart the deployment of a 28-satellite constellation of infrared space sensors in low Earth orbit

title: Astra’s Rocket 3.3 returns to flight with successful launch
summary: Astra successfully returned its Rocket 3.3 vehicle to flight March 15, placing several payloads into low Earth orbit.

title: Kymeta secures $84 million to scale up antenna production
summary: Antenna maker Kymeta said March 15 it has raised $84 million to expand manufacturing facilities ahead of deploying its first flat panel, electronically steered user terminals for low Earth orbit (LEO) satellites this year.
